message.body: oma and i want to know if you'll bring our scrabble game with you!
I will bring scrabble and flux. You got a letter from Emory today. Should i open it?
yes!
I didnt open it because i could read it up to a light. Congratulations! Dean's List!
I am super proud of you btw!
thanks! i'm so excited!
80 points and the win at Happy Ours tonight! Woo hoo!
look at you! very exciting!
I helped even less than usual, but i was there. The team was quite stoked. We got everything right except two in a row in round 4, but nobody else got them either.
that's awesome! wish i coulda been there!
You would have been impressed. There were about five that we pulled totally out or butts. Like who the patron saint of Scotland is.
andrew? says oma.
Correct! How about the length of a ping pong table?
84 inches
that's my guess
nine feet. How about What musical instrument did Sherlock Holmes play in Arthur Conan Doyle's books?
in that bbc show sherlock he plays violin.
Right! What century when Napoleon became ruler?
eighteenth? i would've answered sooner but i was in the shower
Brandon knew it was 1804 somehow so nineteenth but i would have said 16th so dont feel bad.
that's a trick question! haha.
How about what city in Italy is the LaScala opera house in? This is one of the ones all the teams got wrong.
venice? i have no idea
We said Florence. Its in Milan. Who was the 34th President?
"number 34's dwight d. eisenhower, with that name it's hard to disguise your power" thanks brain beats

You rock! We had to brute force it by listing back from Bush Sr. Last one i remember. What is a PARURE? A tribal head dress, an elephant saddle, a type of jewelry that comes in pairs, or an extended period in an opera with no singing?
how is it pronounced?
Pah-roo-er. I think.
probably the jewelry one, then. unlikely spelling for something non-european (options 1 and 2) and it probably be pa-roo-ray (like italian-ish) if it was opera-related.
Well you would have been the only one in the whole place that got it. We could have had an 84!
i just looked it up on wiki and it said that napoleon liked to lavish them on his first wife (josephine). ironic!
i bet that is how the question writers came up with it.
probably! sneaky question writers. any other good trivias from tonight?
Nah. The rest were easy or i dont remember them. Unless you want to try the final.
what was the topic?
Put four 90s events in order
i'll pass, thanks, unless my birth is one of them.
Nope. Sorry!
boo. oh well.
Did you do your dessert tonight?
yup! it went over well and there's leftover, it'll probably keep til monday.
Cool. Hope i get there before it disappears!
i'll save you a piece! anyway, i'm toast, so i'll ttyllllllll
Later!
happy father's day!
Thank you very much! Thanks again for the cool picture too! See you tomorrow. I will try to let you know when i an underway.
sounds good!
did you hear that paul and linda probably aren't coming until tuesday?
No. Perhaps i wont either. Whats on the schedule for tomorrow night?
we don't know...
Hmmm. Let me get back to you in a bit.
haha, okay. everyone says they don't mind.
Cool. How about those shoes?
i wear a size 10.
They were in your suitcase. The one with the shiny green ribbon on it.
that's... weird...
Swateye thought too.
It is official. I an not heading to the beach until Tuesday. Sorry for any inconvenience!
no inconvenience! just don't forget scrabble.
No worries. It is already in the pile.
